metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3910 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.Description: Use After Free vulnerability in Linux Kernel allows Privilege Escalation.An improper Update of Reference Count in io_uring leads to Use-After-Freeand Local Privilege Escalation. When io_msg_ring was invoked with a fixedfile, it called io_fput_file() which improperly decreased its referencecount (leading to Use-After-Free and Local Privilege Escalation). Fixedfiles are permanently registered to the ring, and should not be putseparately. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
